content.question:
Figure 1. Model of <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>DNA</mi></math> structure in the absence and presence of ethidium bromide

Ethidium bromide is a chemical that disrupts the replication of <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>DNA</mi></math>. Based on the model shown in Figure 1, which of the following best describes the effect of ethidium bromide on <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>DNA</mi></math> structure?

choices.label: It is inserted between complementary nitrogenous bases, causing the two strands of <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>DNA</mi></math> to denature.
It is inserted between complementary nitrogenous bases, causing hydrogen bonds to form between noncomplementary nitrogenous bases.
It is inserted between sequential nitrogenous base pairs, increasing the length of the <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>DNA</mi></math> molecule.
It is inserted in place of certain nitrogenous base pairs, decreasing the length of the <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>DNA</mi></math> molecule.

content.answer: It is inserted between sequential nitrogenous base pairs, increasing the length of the <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>DNA</mi></math> molecule.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
